text: BattlEye is a proprietary anti-cheat software that looks for players who cheat in online games. It tries to find people who use tricks or hacks to gain an unfair advantage. It was first introduced in 2004 for a game called Battlefield Vietnam. Now, many other online games use it, especially shooting games like PUBG, Arma 3, Destiny 2, War Thunder, Grand Theft Auto Online, and DayZ. A German company called BattlEye Innovations e. K. creates the BattlEye anti-cheat program. Their main headquarters is in a city called Reutlingen. == Reference == Category:Software Category:Establishments in Germany Category:2004 establishments in Europe
title: BattlEye
